data.enText: an occasion when a tyre suddenly bursts on a vehicle while it is moving
a large meal at which people eat too much
a large party or social occasion
We're going to have a huge blowout for Valentine's Day.
data.chText: 情人节时我们会举办一场盛大聚会。
这场比赛赢得易如反掌，结果是8比1。

data.enText: a sudden escape of oil or gas from an oil well

tr: a sudden malfunction of a part or apparatus
example: the right front tire had a blowout
as a result of the blowout we lost all the lights

example.ex: Once in a while we had a major blowout.

value.def: A blowout is a large meal, often a celebration with family or friends, at which people may eat too much.

example.ex: A lorry travelling south had a blow-out and crashed.
example.tran: 一辆南行的卡车爆胎并撞车了。

value.def: If you have a blowout while you are driving a car, one of the tyres suddenly bursts.

example.ex: ...a blow-out in the balance of payments.

value.def: A blowout in an amount or a price is a sudden increase in it.

types.define: 台湾电视史上第一个棒球竞赛游戏节目「打击出去」，一起来挑战。总教头阳帆，投、打、接、跑，重重难关下战书，挑战全能MVP，全民疯棒球。
